[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 34]
Reasoning: **Analyzing the Ante, Joker Synergy, and Shop to Maximize Value**

Okay, here's the situation: Ante 3, Round 4. Got $20 in the bank. I've got a decent Joker setup: Mail-In Rebate (mult and money), Ride the Bus (scaling High Card/Three of a Kind), Red Card (scaling, but dependent on skipping boosters), Blue Joker (chips), and Scholar (Ace synergy). I also have a Magician consumable ready to go. The Telescope voucher is active, so I know I'll get a planet card that will likely enhance a High Card or Three of a Kind.

My primary focus here is maximizing my hand's potential. DNA in the shop is the key to that since I have Scholar and Aces in the deck, so my thoughts are revolving around the best way to get it. This "If first hand of round has only 1 card, add a permanent copy to deck and draw it to hand." is huge. If I can get multiple aces out in a round, Scholar will scale the mult very, very quickly. It synergizes so well with my Scholar Joker.

The shop has DNA ($8), Lusty Joker ($5), a Buffoon Pack ($4, not helpful right now since I have 5/5 Jokers), and a Celestial Pack ($4, potentially useful with the Telescope). Hieroglyph (-1 Ante, -1 hand) is also tempting for scaling, but a permanent hand penalty is risky this early.

First, I need to decide what to do with my existing Jokers. Red Card is my weakest link right now. At +6 mult, it only scales by skipping booster packs, and I have Telescope. It feels the least valuable compared to Mail-In Rebate and Scholar (Ace synergy) in my current Joker set. Since I'll want a Celestial Pack if I can fit it, skipping a pack is not optimal.

I can't just buy DNA; I'm at 5/5 Jokers. So I need to dump a joker. I can't dump Scholar, because it's integral to the DNA strategy. Mail-In Rebate is good for income, but it's not core to a scaling strategy.

It looks like the best play is to buy DNA and the Celestial Pack. I'll dump Red Card to make space. Since DNA costs $8 and the Celestial Pack costs $4, that's a total of $12 with the Celestial Pack.

Let's do the math: I have $20, sell Red Card for $2, and buy DNA for $8. That leaves $14. Then, I buy the Celestial Pack for $4. I'll still have $10 left over.

Okay, here's my plan: First, I sell Red Card. Then, I buy DNA and the Celestial Pack.

[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 35]
Reasoning: **Current Decision: Buy DNA**

Okay, here's the breakdown of my thought process. I'm in Ante 3, Round 4 with $22 and a decent setup, but I need to optimize for the long game. I've got a Telescope Voucher, and a solid Joker lineup: Mail-In Rebate, Ride the Bus, Blue Joker, and Scholar. I sold a Red Card last turn to make room for a new card, and I have The Magician consumable available.

The shop offers a juicy DNA card for $8. It duplicates the first card played each round if it's a single card hand. This is an absolute game-changer with Scholar, because I can start with an Ace and make it permanent. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
